excerpt: Once a monastery built around 1500 CE, this historic structure houses a renovated museum & garden.
detail_description: The Monastery of Ayia Napa, originally constructed in 1500 CE, has been transformed into a museum and garden. This historic landmark is a significant religious and architectural site in Cyprus, with a captivating legend about the discovery of an icon of the Virgin Mary. The monastery's Venetian-era architecture adds to its centuries-old charm. Visitors can also enjoy nearby attractions such as Aiya Napa beach, known for sunbathing, water sports, and shopping.
name: Monastery of Ayia Napa

excerpt: This idyllic stretch of sand beach has earned a blue flag designation for its clean, aqua waters.
detail_description: Nissi Beach is a renowned destination in Cyprus, known for its golden sands and clear aquamarine waters. It has been awarded the blue flag designation for its cleanliness. Located near Ayia Napa, it is easily accessible by public transport and offers a range of activities including swimming, water sports, shopping, and dining. The 600-meter coastline attracts large crowds with beach parties and music.
name: Nissi Beach

excerpt: Museum with a cafe & a gift shop exploring Cyprus' seafaring history with fossils & other exhibits.
detail_description: Thalassa Municipal Museum is a museum in Cyprus that delves into the seafaring history of the region. The museum features exhibits spanning from paleontological to prehistoric periods up to modern times. Visitors can see a life-size replica of the ancient ship of Kyrenia, a Mesolithic papyrus vessel, and a traditional Cypriot boat from the 19th century.
name: Thalassa

excerpt: Contemporary sculptures of mythical beasts & ancient gods in a landscaped park with sea views.
detail_description: The Sculpture Park in Ayia Napa is a captivating 20,000 square meter landscaped park featuring contemporary sculptures of mythical beasts and ancient gods. Situated at the crossroads of Cape Gkreko and Kryou Nerou Avenue, this park offers stunning sea views and a serene setting for leisurely strolls.
name: Sculpture Open Park
address: X2P8+8PF, Kavo Gkreko, Ayia Napa 5330, Cyprus

excerpt: Dramatic coastal area with rugged bluffs & sea caves, popular with divers and cliff jumpers.
detail_description: Located about 7.5km from Ayia Napa, the Sea Caves at Cape Greco offer a dramatic coastal landscape with rugged bluffs and natural formations overlooking the Mediterranean Sea. These caves are popular among divers and cliff jumpers, attracting both locals and tourists. The area also features Hellenistic and Roman tombs, adding to its historical significance. Visitors can enjoy a leisurely walk while taking in the captivating scenery shaped by nature over time.
name: Sea Caves
address: Sea Caves, Agia Napa, E307, Ayia Napa 5330, Cyprus

excerpt: Rugged peninsula & national park with cliffside hikes, a turquoise lagoon & a natural rock bridge.
detail_description: Cape Cavo Greco, located east of Agia Napa and southeast of Protaras, is a stunning national park and conservation area spanning 385 hectares. The rugged peninsula features cliffside hikes, a turquoise lagoon, and a natural rock bridge. Visitors can explore nature trails lined with Calabrian pine trees and Phoenician junipers, perfect for hiking and cycling. The Aphrodite Nature Trail offers a scenic route along the southeast coast of the promontory.
name: Cape Cavo Greco

excerpt: Beyond its fine sand & clear waters, this scenic bay beach features an ancient burial site.
detail_description: Makronissos Beach is a picturesque cluster of three bays, featuring fine golden sands and calm, crystal-clear waters. This 350-meter long beach offers a serene and family-friendly atmosphere with its trio of crescent-shaped coves. It's an ideal spot for swimming and relaxation, making it perfect for families with young children. The beach also boasts facilities such as toilets, changing rooms, sun beds, umbrellas, and water sports facilities.
name: Makronissos Beach

excerpt: Large water park featuring slides, wave pools & kids' areas, all with an Ancient Greece theme.
detail_description: WaterWorld Themed Waterpark in Ayia Napa is a large water park with an Ancient Greece theme, offering 35 mythology-themed rides and attractions for families to enjoy. From the hair-raising Fall of Icarus to the Danaides Childrens Playground, there's something for everyone.
name: WaterWorld Themed Waterpark Ayia Napa
address: 18, Ayia Thekla Road, Agia Napa (Ayia Napa) 5345, Cyprus

detail_description: Ayia Napa Square is a vibrant hub at the heart of Ayia Napa, offering an array of entertainment options. It's renowned for its lively nightlife, with numerous bars and clubs where you can revel in affordable drinks until late. The square also boasts diverse dining choices, from traditional Cypriot fare to international cuisine, ensuring there's something to satisfy every palate. Additionally, visitors can explore various activities such as fairground rides and go-karting nearby.
name: Ayia Napa Square

detail_description: Makronissos Ancient Tombs, located in the western part of Ayia Napa, offer a unique blend of history and beach relaxation. Dating back to the Hellenistic and Roman period, these tombs provide insight into ancient burial practices. The site includes nineteen stone-cut tombs, a small sanctuary, and an ancient quarry. Despite being looted over the centuries, the tombs still showcase remnants of funeral pyres and large clay sarcophagi.
name: Makronissos Ancient Tombs

detail_description: Located in Cyprus, the Bridge of Love is a popular natural arch known for its vivid colored panels and stunning views. Legend has it that kissing your lover on the bridge will make your wishes come true. It's a great spot for taking Instagram-worthy photos and is also a popular location for wedding photos. The area offers something for everyone, from sea monks in the morning to swimming, snorkeling, and watching the sunset in the afternoon.
name: Bridge of Love

excerpt: This popular developed beach features golden sand, swimming, umbrella rentals & more.
detail_description: Landa Beach, also known as Golden Paradise Beach, is a tranquil and lesser-known beach located at the western edge of Ayia Napa. It boasts a long stretch of golden sand and shallow waters, making it an ideal choice for families with children. The beach offers umbrella rentals and various water sports activities for more adventurous visitors. Unlike the vibrant atmosphere of Pantachou Beach, Landa Beach provides a peaceful escape with its serene surroundings.
name: Landa Beach

excerpt: Sizable amusement park offering a variety of rides & games, along with concession stands.
detail_description: Parko Paliatso Luna Park is a large amusement park located near Protaras in Ayia Napa, Cyprus. It offers a wide range of rides and games for visitors of all ages. With the purchase of a Premium Wristband, guests can enjoy unlimited access to selected attractions, ensuring an evening filled with excitement and fun. The park features various rides such as the Sling Shot, giant Ferris wheel, merry-go-round, bumper cars, and train rides.
name: Parko Paliatso Luna Park

excerpt: Ayia Napa is a Mediterranean resort town on the southeast coast of Cyprus, known for its beaches. The town's main landmark is the storied, Venetian-era Ayia Napa Monastery, which stands in the central square of Plateia Seferi, surrounded by bars and clubs. Freshly caught seafood is served at Ayia Napa Harbour’s busy tavernas, while adjoining Pantachou Beach offers a stretch of golden sand.
detail_description: Ayia Napa, a Mediterranean resort town on the southeast coast of Cyprus, is renowned for its stunning beaches and vibrant nightlife. The iconic Ayia Napa Monastery, dating back to the Venetian era, is a prominent landmark in the central square of Plateia Seferi. This bustling area is surrounded by lively bars and clubs. Visitors can savor freshly caught seafood at the busy tavernas in Ayia Napa Harbour while enjoying the golden sands of Pantachou Beach nearby.
name: Ayia Napa

excerpt: Protaras is a resort town in eastern Cyprus, known for its beaches and for Fig Tree Bay with its old, lone fig tree. Above the bay are excavated Hellenistic tombs. To the northwest, atop a rock, the limestone Church of Profitis Ilias marks one end of a nature trail that leads to Konnos Beach. To the south, Cape Greco National Forest Park has clear waters and protected pine forest trails.
detail_description: Protaras, a resort town in eastern Cyprus, is renowned for its stunning beaches and the iconic Fig Tree Bay. The area also features Hellenistic tombs overlooking the bay and the limestone Church of Profitis Ilias atop a rock. Nature enthusiasts can explore the trails leading to Konnos Beach and Cape Greco National Forest Park with its pristine waters and pine forest trails.
name: Protaras

detail_description: Experience the ultimate nightlife at The Castle Club, a renowned venue in Ayia Napa. Boasting five separate arenas, this iconic club offers an unforgettable party atmosphere where you can dance to top DJs and artists. With state-of-the-art sound systems and immersive visuals, every beat resonates deep within your soul. Whether you're sipping drinks on the chillout terrace or dancing the night away, The Castle Club is the place to be.
name: The Castle Club

detail_description: Poseidon Beach, also known as Ayia Thekla Beach, is a stunning coastal stretch located 6.5 km west of Agia Napa. This natural sandy beach features crystal-clear calm waters and a rocky bottom covered in golden sands. Visitors can enjoy facilities such as sun beds, umbrellas, water sports, toilets, and changing rooms. Additionally, there are nearby convenience stores and various dining options available.
name: Ayia Thekla Beach

excerpt: Harbor with a stone walkway, colorful fishing boats, fish restaurants & an adjacent sandy beach.
detail_description: Ayia Napa Harbour is a picturesque waterfront area with a stone walkway, vibrant fishing boats, and charming fish restaurants. Visitors can enjoy leisurely strolls while taking in the bustling atmosphere and sampling fresh seafood at the waterfront eateries. The harbor also offers boat tours for various experiences, from lively party boats to serene private catamarans. For those interested in underwater exploration, scuba diving is popular here, allowing enthusiasts to discover sea life and intriguing shipwrecks.
name: Ayia Napa Harbour

excerpt: 1.2-km. sandy beach featuring sun bed rentals, changing rooms, eateries & water-sports vendors.
detail_description: Pantachou Beach, also known as Grecian Bay Beach, is a stunning 1.2-km stretch of golden sands and calm crystal-clear waters located east of the harbor of Ayia Napa. This Blue Flag beach offers various amenities such as sun bed rentals, changing rooms, and water sports facilities. The area surrounding the beach boasts accommodation options, restaurants, and kiosks for added convenience.
name: Pantachou Beach

detail_description: Blue Lagoon is a stunning destination located on the north side of Cape Greco Peninsula in Ayia Napa, Cyprus. Accessible by boat from Protaras, visitors can enjoy scenic sea caves along the way. The area features rocky outcrops and incredibly clear azure-blue waters perfect for swimming and diving. While there is no sandy beach, the beauty of the bay makes it a must-visit spot.
name: Blue Lagoon

excerpt: Small sand beach featuring rental loungers & umbrellas, water sports & clear, calm waters.
detail_description: Fig Tree Bay is a stunning beach located just outside Ayia Napa in Protaras. It boasts clear, calm waters and offers rental loungers and umbrellas for visitors to relax on the small sand beach. The bay is named after a fig tree planted by eastern invaders in the 17th century and is known for its crystal-clear waters, earning it the prestigious Blue Flag status. Visitors can enjoy various water sports such as skiing, paragliding, snorkeling, and scuba diving.
name: Fig Tree

excerpt: Bucolic national park featuring numerous trails & cycling paths, sitting areas, cliffs & sea views.
detail_description: Cavo Greco National Park is a picturesque and serene destination offering an array of outdoor activities. The park features numerous trails and cycling paths, providing opportunities for hiking and exploring the stunning landscape. Visitors can enjoy breathtaking sea views, cliffs, natural rock formations, and sea caves. The area is also home to rare plant species including orchids and irises. Additionally, the park offers opportunities for snorkeling in its turquoise waters.
name: Cavo Greco National Park

detail_description: Nestled between the vibrant municipalities of Ayia Napa and Sotira, the charming Ayia Thekla Chapel is a delightful gem dedicated to Agia Thekla. This picturesque chapel, adorned in classic blue and white hues, offers stunning views of the endless azure sea. It stands proudly beside the ruins of an ancient church that dates back to the 4th century, hinting at a rich historical tapestry woven into its surroundings.
name: Ayia Thekla Chapel

excerpt: Small beach in a bay with shallow waters, popular for water sports, snorkeling & oceanfront eats.
detail_description: Vathia Gonia Beach, also known as Sandy Bay, is a charming 300-meter long beach located just 2.2 kilometers west of Ayia Napa's center and 400 meters east of Nissi Beach. This sandy beach is nestled in a natural rocky bay with fine golden sands and calm crystal-clear waters, making it an ideal spot for water sports and snorkeling.
name: Vathia Gonia

detail_description: The Ayia Napa Aqueduct, a significant monument in the area, has been preserved since Roman times and played a crucial role in supplying water to the region. This historic structure, with its complex 2-kilometer-long design, utilized gravity to deliver water to the monastery and surrounding areas. It stands as a testament to the region's history and is an important reminder of ancient engineering and architectural achievements.
name: Ayia Napa Aqueduct

excerpt: Sandy beach with clear, shallow water for swimming & water sports, plus chair rentals.
detail_description: Konnos Beach is a picturesque sandy beach located near the bustling resort town of Ayia Napa and the quaint village of Protaras in Cyprus. The area features a scenic pedestrian walkway with viewing platforms and benches for relaxation, offering a memorable descent to the shoreline. With clear, shallow waters ideal for swimming and water sports, this serene bay is surrounded by towering rocky mountains, creating a tranquil setting for beachgoers.
name: Konnos Beach

excerpt: Sandy spot known for its clear waters, with rows of umbrella-shaded sun loungers & nearby sea caves.
detail_description: Glyki Nero Beach is a popular sandy spot in Protaras known for its clear waters and rows of umbrella-shaded sun loungers. It is located close to the town center, making it easily accessible for visitors. The beach offers a safe environment, suitable for families with children, and provides various water sports activities such as surfing, parasailing, and jet-skiing.
name: Glyki Nero Beach

excerpt: Rugged coastal caves in cliffs reaching 262 ft., with tunnels, arches & an observation platform.
name: Sea Caves

excerpt: Small church with a stone facade & paintings on display, perched on a hill with scenic water views.
detail_description: Perched on a hill just outside the main tourist area of Protaras, Profitis Ilias, also known as the Church of Saint Elias, is a small Greek Orthodox church with Byzantine architecture and captivating stone walls. Despite being built in 1984, it exudes an ancient charm. To reach the chapel, visitors must climb 153 steps, but the effort is rewarded with breathtaking panoramic views of Protaras.
name: St elias church

detail_description: Crow's Arch, also known as Kamara tou Koraka bridge, is a famous natural limestone bridge located in the stunning landscape of Cavo Greco in Ayia Napa. Accessible by both walking and car, it offers breathtaking views and is a popular spot for visitors. However, due to its fragile state, the area around the bridge is fenced off to prevent any potential collapse. Despite this restriction, visitors can still enjoy the beauty of this natural wonder from a distance.
name: Crow's Arch
address: X3CG+M56, Road to Agioi Anargiroi, Protaras 5330, Cyprus

detail_description: Established in 1985 by British expats, Blueberries Restaurant is renowned for its fusion of English and Cypriot cuisine. The restaurant offers a diverse menu featuring dishes such as tyrokafteri hot pepper and cheese dip, buffalo chicken wings, king prawns, swordfish, fillet steaks, and traditional Cypriot specialties like moussaka and sheftalies.
name: Blueberries

detail_description: Green Bay Beach in Protaras, Cyprus is a favorite spot for families with children due to its smooth entry into the water and sandy bottom. The beach offers amenities such as changing cabins, showers, sun loungers, lifeguard observation, and even Wi-Fi. It's described as a cozy and fun sandy bay that resembles the neck of a bottle when viewed from above.
name: Green Bay Beach

detail_description: The MUSAN Museum of Underwater Sculpture Ayia Napa is a captivating underwater park featuring 130 sculptures created by renowned reef artist Jason deCaires Taylor. These sculptures are strategically designed with materials that attract coral, creating an enchanting wildlife habitat. The museum, which opened in 2021, offers a unique experience for both snorkelers and scuba divers to explore the mesmerizing underwater forest and admire the art pieces submerged at depths ranging from 8 to 10 meters.
name: MUSAN Museum of Underwater Sculpture Ayia Napa

detail_description: Club Black N' White in Ayia Napa is a legendary venue known for its dedication to urban music. With a focus on R&B, reggae, garage, and hip hop, it offers a unique alternative to the dominant dance and electronic scene in the area. The club has earned numerous awards for its genre-specific approach and has hosted international DJs and celebrity artists over the years.
name: Club Black N' White - Ayia Napa

detail_description: Agia Thekla is a charming and picturesque church located near the sea in Cyprus. It is known for its beautiful architecture and serene surroundings, making it a popular spot for visitors seeking tranquility and spiritual reflection. The church is dedicated to Agia Thekla, a revered saint in the Orthodox tradition, adding to its significance for pilgrims and worshippers.
name: Agia Thekla

detail_description: Undersea World Scuba Diving Centre in Cyprus offers a range of adventurous activities, including Quad Bike Safari, boat trips along the stunning coastline, and scuba diving in the crystal clear Mediterranean sea. The center provides opportunities to explore the surreal world beneath the ocean's surface with various diving spots near beaches and deeper areas. Visitors praise the professional equipment and preparation at the center, as well as the caring and fun attitude of staff members like Elena.
name: Undersea World Scuba Diving Centre

detail_description: Nissi Ave in Ayia Napa is a bustling street lined with various resorts and shops, making it a perfect spot for some retail therapy while on vacation. The avenue is always busy with tourists and locals, creating a vibrant atmosphere for shopping. With an array of retailers offering their products, visitors can easily find everything from souvenirs to trendy fashion items along this lively stretch.
name: Nissi Ave
Ayioi Anargiroi Church
address: X3GG+6FP, Road to Agioi Anargiroi, Ayia Napa 5330, Cyprus

detail_description: Ammos Kambouri Beach is a peaceful and secluded spot located on the eastern edge of Ayia Napa, Cyprus. It stretches along the coast to the sea caves and offers a small sandy area with cabanas and luxury sun loungers. The beach is surrounded by rocky hills, modest vegetation, and crystal-clear calm waters. It's an ideal place to relax, breathe in the cool air, and listen to the soothing sound of sea waves.
name: Ammos Kambouri Beach

detail_description: Dolfin's Luna Park, situated in the heart of Ayia Napa Harbour, is a classic amusement park offering entertainment for the whole family. With various games and attractions suitable for children of all ages, it's a perfect spot to enjoy sweet treats like cotton candy and ice cream while kids test their skills at different games. The park also features live entertainment throughout the day.
name: Dolfin's Luna Park (Ayia Napa Harbour)
address: 43 Arch. Makariou Limanaki, Ayia Napa, Cyprus

detail_description: Cyclops Cave is a stunning coastal route located in the northeastern end of Cape Greko National Park, near Protaras in Cyprus. The path starts from Konnou Avenue and leads to the majestic Cyclops cave, which boasts two entrances and sits about 15m above sea level. Visitors can also explore the ruins of the church of Aphrodite, a rock-bridge hanging over water, and underwater caves with natural columns and vaults.
name: Cyclops Cave
address: X3PG+HJQ, Κόννος - Σπηλιά του Κύκλωπα, Paralimni 5297, Cyprus

excerpt: Hearty Mexican dishes are served with blended cocktails at this lively open-air establishment.
detail_description: Los Bandidos Restaurant in Ayia Napa, Cyprus offers a lively open-air dining experience with authentic Mexican cuisine and blended cocktails. Despite being an unexpected find in Cyprus, this restaurant is known for its enticing menu featuring dishes like chilaquiles, pozole, tostadas, and tacos al pastor at affordable prices. Whether you're seeking a quiet meal or hosting a special dinner, Los Bandidos caters to all occasions.
name: Los Bandidos Restaurant Ayia Napa

detail_description: In Protaras, Cyprus, there are plenty of exciting activities to enjoy, including daily trips and excursions. For a unique experience, consider visiting Agioi Saranta Cave Church. This hidden gem is located about 2.5 miles (4 km) away from the main area and requires a moderately steep trek to reach it. Despite the challenging climb, the church's interior boasts stunning images of saints and features a beautiful small dome.
name: Agioi Saranta Cave Church

detail_description: The Pirates Inn is a popular spot for partying in Ayia Napa. It features pirate-themed decor and often gets crowded, so it's not the best place to go if you want to find some peace and quiet. The staff are lovely, though, and there's usually plenty of space to move around late at night.
name: Pirates Inn Ayia Napa

detail_description: Sage Restaurant & Wine Bar in Ayia Napa offers a sophisticated dining experience with traditional Cypriot dishes and an impressive selection of local and international wines. The restaurant prides itself on providing exceptional quality food and service in an elegant and welcoming atmosphere, making it suitable for the whole family. With its fully trained staff, Sage ensures a memorable evening for every visitor. Guests can expect delicious cuisine, attentive service, and a diverse wine list to complement their meals.
name: Sage Restaurant

detail_description: The Deck is a 5 stars hotel restaurant with a beautiful view and great food. It's a bit pricey but the food and service are worth it. Didi was an amazing waitress who made our trip even better.
name: The Deck Terrace Restaurant

detail_description: Located in the fifth floor of the Grecian Sands Hotel, Roof Burger Bar offers an incredible view of the Mediterranean sea as you enjoy burgers and fries. They have a variety of burgers on offer including a veggie option, and all are accompanied by the breathtaking view over the Mediterranean sea.
name: Roof Burger Bar
